title: 'I could not be more proud' - what next for Wales in World Cup play-offs?
description: As Wales prepare for their first World Cup play-offs since 1958, BBC Sport Wales looks at their potential opponents and routes to Qatar.

title: Ollie the comfort dog makes getting jabbed a little easier for California children
description: Ollie the Goldendoodle is helping California children overcome their fear of getting a Covid jab.

title: Which MPs have second jobs and how much do they earn?
description: Boris Johnson is proposing to ban MPs from acting as paid political consultants - Labour is also calling for a ban.

title: Job vacancies: Which sectors are short of workers?
description: There are record numbers of empty posts so which sectors are looking to recruit?

title: Poland border crisis: Scene of chaos as soldiers deploy water cannon
description: The BBC's Steve Rosenberg reports as Polish forces fire water cannon at migrants throwing rocks.

title: Liverpool bomb: Four freed as suspect killed in blast named
description: Arrested men released without charge as police say they have made "significant progress" in the case.

title: Yvonne Fletcher shooting: Libyan close to Gaddafi found jointly liable for killing of PC
description: PC Fletcher was killed outside the Libyan Embassy in 1984 during a protest by anti-Gaddafi activists.

title: Azeem Rafiq: English cricket is 'institutionally' racist says former Yorkshire player
description: Former Yorkshire player Azeem Rafiq says racist language was "constantly" used at the club and is an issue throughout domestic cricket.

title: Poland border crisis: Migrants tear-gassed trying to cross from Belarus
description: Poland's defence ministry says migrants were throwing stones and trying to destroy a border fence.

title: Workers call the shots as job vacancies boom
description: Vacancies hit a fresh record high in October, forcing employers to offer more to attract new recruits.

title: From John O'Groats to Land's End in world's smallest car
description: Alex Orchin expects to take to two to three weeks to travel from John O'Groats to Land's End.

title: Azeem Rafiq says he received 'inhuman treatment' during 'difficult pregnancy'
description: Former Yorkshire cricketer Azeem Rafiq tells a select committee he received "inhuman treatment" during a "difficult pregnancy".

title: Benjamin Mendy: Manchester City footballer charged with two further rapes
description: The footballer, who previously faced four counts of rape, is summonsed over two more offences.

title: I'm A Celebrity 2021: Richard Madeley and Louise Minchin lead line-up
description: The ITV show returns on Sunday and will be broadcast from Wales for the second year running.

title: Two women accuse PM's father Stanley Johnson of inappropriate touching
description: Two women, one of them a Tory MP, allege Stanley Johnson smacked and groped them.

title: Bale out of Wales' World Cup qualifier against Belgium
description: Real Madrid forward Gareth Bale has not been included in Wales' squad for Tuesday's final World Cup group match against Belgium.

title: Derby facing relegation after being handed further points deduction
description: Derby County are docked nine points for breaching accounting rules, leaving them facing the prospect of Championship relegation.

title: NBA: 'Oh my goodness!' - Karl-Anthony Towns' deep buzzer-beater leads plays of the week
description: Minnesota Timberwolves centre Karl-Anthony Towns' game-tying shot against the Memphis Grizzlies is among many buzzer-beaters in NBA plays of the week.

title: Wales rugby: Christ Tshiunza thanks former PE teacher
description: As Tshiunza gets his Wales debut, his old teachers joke 'is it something in our school dinners?'

title: Five items that are going up in price and why
description: How garden fences and savoury snacks can help us understand why the cost of living is accelerating.

title: NFL Highlights: Deebo Samuel stars as San Francisco 49ers thrash Los Angeles Rams
description: Watch highlights from the San Francisco 49ers' 31-10 win over the Los Angeles Rams, including two touchdowns from wide receiver Deebo Samuel.

title: Pfeiffer Georgi: British champion on crashing, confidence and her breakthrough
description: British champion Pfeiffer Georgi on why 2021 was her breakthrough year, recovering from crash trauma and her development from the junior ranks.

title: Biden-Xi talks: China warns US about 'playing with fire' on Taiwan
description: Xi Jinping and Joe Biden hold substantial talks but exchange sharp words on Taiwan.

title: Radio 1's Big Weekend 2022 to be live in Coventry
description: The three-day event will be live again after two online festivals due to the pandemic.

title: Azeem Rafiq: Yorkshire cricket racism scandal - how we got here
description: BBC Sport sets out the timeline of the Azeem Rafiq racism scandal that has engulfed Yorkshire County Cricket Club and English cricket.

title: The Papers: Taxi bomb suspect and Covid booster jabs
description: Tuesday's front pages focus on the suspect in Sunday's Liverpool bombing.

title: Covid: The country locking down the unvaccinated
description: Some two million people without Covid-19 jabs have been told to stay home in Austria.

title: Brighton student 'degraded and disgusted' by stalker asking for sex
description: Reanna Burns says she was followed by a man who later asked her if she would have sex for £100.

title: Russian anti-satellite missile test draws condemnation
description: The US says Russia "recklessly" destroyed a satellite, endangering astronauts in space.

title: The US city run by Muslim Americans
description: Once a Polish enclave, Hamtramck, Michigan is now the first US city with an all-Muslim government.

title: Rod Stewart reveals why he didn't play Live Aid
description: The star clears up his absence from the charity gig, and insists he doesn't style his hair with mayo.

title: Covid denial to climate denial: How conspiracists are shifting focus
description: Anti-lockdown movements online are turning their attention to climate conspiracy theories.

title: China's ultramarathon tragedy and the survivors threatened for speaking out
description: In May this year, 21 athletes died at an ultra-running event in northern China. Some survivors have been threatened for telling their story.

title: The women of Iran's underground metal scene
description: Women are forbidden from singing publicly in Iran except in choirs or female-only company.

title: Giovanni Rose: Tottenham teenager wins poetry award
description: Teenager Giovanni Rose won an international competition with his poem Welcome to Tottenham.
